string-array.name: Joke
string-array.item: When one door of happiness closes, another opens, but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one that has been opened for us.\n\n ~Helen Keller
There is only one person who could ever make you happy, and that person is you.\n\n ~David Burns
Happiness is not a state to arrive at, but a manner of traveling.\n\n ~Margaret Lee Runbeck
Action may not always bring happiness; but there is no happiness without action.\n\n ~Benjamin Disraeli
Try not to become a man of success but a man of value.\n\n ~Albert Einstein
They can because they think they can.\n\n ~Virgil
Nothing can stop the man with the right mental attitude from achieving his goal; nothing on earth can help the man with the wrong mental attitude.\n\n ~Thomas Jefferson
There is only one success--to be able to spend your life in your own way.\n\n ~Christopher Morley
The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack in will.\n\n ~Vince Lombardi
You can find inspiration from others but determination is solely your responsibility.\n\n ~Dodinsky
When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.\n\n ~Henry Ford
\' EGO \' is the only requirement to destroy any relationship... so be the bigger person, SKIP the \' E \' and Let it \' GO \'.\n\n ~Anonymous
Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.\n\n ~Anonymous
It\'s not that some people have willpower and some don\'t. It\'s that some people are ready to change and others are not.\n\n ~Anonymous
Never test the depth of river with both the feet.\n\n ~Warren Buffet
Believe you can and you are halfway there.\n\n ~Theodore Roosevelt
The dream is not what you see in sleep, dream is which does not let you sleep.\n\n ~Dr Abdul Kalam
There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.\n\n ~Nelson Mandela
The best way to prepare for life is to begin to live.\n\n ~Elbert Hubbard
We make our fortunes, and we call them fate.\n\n ~Earl of Beaconsfield
Most successful men have not achieved their distinction by having some new talent or opportunity presented to them. They have developed the opportunity that was at hand.\n\n ~Bruce Barton
The biggest risk in life is not taking a risk at all.\n\n ~Anonymous
It is our attitude at the beginning of a difficult task which, more than anything else, will affect It\'s successful outcome.\n\n ~William James
Everyone has his burden. What counts is how you carry it.\n\n ~Merle Miller
The state of your life is nothing more than a reflection of your state of mind.\n\n ~Dr. Wayne W. Dyer
Always look at what you have left.Never look at what you have lost.\n\n ~Robert H. Schuller
If you believe you can, you probably can. If you believe you won\'t, you most assuredly won\'t. Belief is the ignition switch that gets you off the launching pad.\n\n ~Denis Waitley
Ability is what you\'re capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.\n\n ~Lou Holtz
Whatever is begun in anger ends in shame.\n\n ~Benjamin Franklin
Life is a great big canvas, and you should throw all the paint on it you can.\n\n ~Danny Kaye
Life consists not in holding good cards but in playing those you hold well.\n\n ~Josh Billings
Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.\n\n ~Buddha
All of the animals except for man know that the principle business of life is to enjoy it.\n\n ~Samuel Butler
I have not failed. I\’ve just found 10,000 ways that won\’t work.\n\n ~Thomas Edison
Happiness is not a destination. It is a method of life.\n\n ~Burton Hills
Forgiveness does not change the past, but it does enlarge the future.\n\n ~Paul Boese
All our dreams can come true – if we have the courage to pursue them.\n\n ~Walt Disney
The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart.\n\n ~Helen Keller
And in the end, it\’s not the years in your life that count. It\’s the life in your years.\n\n ~Abraham Lincoln
Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.\n\n ~Peter Marshall
Age wrinkles the body. Quitting wrinkles the soul.\n\n ~Douglas MacArthur
If my mind can conceive it, and my heart can believe it, I know I can achieve it.\n\n ~Jesse Jackson
We cannot direct the wind but we can adjust the sails.\n\n ~Dolly Parton
He who is devoid of the power to forgive, is devoid of the power to love.\n\n ~Martin Luther King, Jr.
There are no failures; just experiences and your reactions to them.\n\n ~Tom Krause
Someone’s opinion of you does not have to become your reality.\n\n ~Les Brown
It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.\n\n ~Albert Einstein
An eye for an eye would make the whole world blind.\n\n ~Mahatma Gandhi
Life\'s challenges are not supposed to paralyze you, they\'re supposed to help you discover who you are.\n\n ~Bernice Johnson Reagon
We would accomplish many more things if we did not think of them as impossible.\n\n ~C. Malesherbes
Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.\n\n ~Dale Carnegie
Desire is the starting point of all achievement, not a hope, not a wish, but a keen pulsating desire which transcends everything.\n\n ~Napoleon Hill
Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.\n\n ~Ralph Waldo Emerson
That some achieve great success, is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.\n\n ~Abraham Lincoln
The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.\n\n ~Winston Churchill
Even if you are on the right track, you\'ll get run over if you just sit there.\n\n ~Will Rogers
It\'s not what happens to you that determines how far you will go in life; it is how you handle what happens to you.\n\n ~Zig Ziglar
Any person capable of angering you becomes your master; he can anger you only when you permit yourself to be disturbed by him.\n\n ~Epictetus
Our ultimate freedom is the right and power to decide how anybody or anything outside ourselves will affect us.\n\n ~Stephen R. Covey
People who consider themselves victims of their circumstances will always remain victims unless they develop a greater vision for their lives.\n\n ~Stedman Graham
If you are looking for yourself, believe me, you will never find "you" because you are what you believe you can become. You, and you alone CREATE your own identity.\n\n ~Thomas D. Willhite
Never say anything about yourself you do not want to come true.\n\n ~Brian Tracy
To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe.\n\n ~Anatole France
Other people\'s opinion of you does not have to become your reality.\n\n ~Les Brown
One of the greatest discoveries a man makes, one of his great surprises, is to find he can do what he was afraid he couldn\'t do.\n\n ~Henry Ford
Every person is the creation of himself, the image of his own thinking and believing. As individuals think and believe, so they are.\n\n ~Claude M. Bristol
People become really quite remarkable when they start thinking that they can do things. When they believe in themselves, they have the first secret of success.\n\n ~Norman Vincent Peale
Believe in your dreams and they may come true; believe in yourself and they will come true.\n\n ~Anonymous
The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.\n\n ~Eleanor Roosevelt
The only thing that stands between a man and what he wants from life is often merely the will to try it and the faith to believe that it is possible.\n\n ~David Viscott
Confidence comes not from always being right but from not fearing to be wrong.\n\n ~Peter T. Mcintyre
Experience tells you what to do; confidence allows you to do it.\n\n ~Stan Smith
Confidence comes from hours and days and weeks and years of constant work and dedication.\n\n ~Roger Staubach
Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow.\n\n ~Ralph Waldo Emerson
We can choose how we want to feel, by choosing how we behave. We feel the way we behave. So if you don\’t like the way you feel, then change your behavior.\n\n ~Thomas D. Willhite
It\'s choice - not chance - that determines your destiny.\n\n ~Jean Nidetch
Do not be afraid to make decisions. Decision-making is all important. The more decisions you make, the more accurate you will become.\n\n ~Thomas D. Willhite
"Taking responsibility" is not hard; it is the "deciding to" take responsibility that is hard.\n\n ~Thomas D. Willhite
Other people and things can stop you temporarily. You\'re the only one who can do it permanently.\n\n ~Zig Ziglar
The men who try to do something and fail are infinitely better than those who try to do nothing and succeed.\n\n ~Lloyd Jones
No one can go back and make a brand new start. Anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.\n\n ~Anonymous
The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential… these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.\n\n ~Eddie Robinson
In the confrontation between the stream and the rock, the stream always wins- not through strength but by perseverance.\n\n ~H. Jackson Brown
We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.\n\n ~Martin Luther King, Jr.
Enthusiasm is followed by disappointment and even depression, and then by renewed enthusiasm.\n\n ~Murray Gell-Mann
Hope is tomorrow\'s veneer over today\'s disappointment.\n\n ~Evan Esar
Expect nothing and accept everything and you will never be disappointed.\n\n ~Laurence Overmire
The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.\n\n ~Robert Kiyosaki
Rigid beliefs make disappointments seem unbearable, whereas realistic beliefs help us to accept disappointment and go on from there.\n\n ~Eileen Kennedy
Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.\n\n ~Epicurus
Some men see things as they are and say \'why\'? Others dream things that never were and say \'why not\'?\n\n ~George Bernard Shaw
Keep your heart open to dreams. For as long as there\'s a dream, there is hope, and as long as there is hope, there is joy in living.\n\n ~Anonymous
A word of encouragement during a failure is worth more than an hour of praise after success.\n\n ~Anonymous
If you have no one to encourage you, instead of using that as an excuse for failure, encourage yourself and use that as a reason why you must succeed.\n\n ~Kevin Ngo
The only good luck many great men ever had was being born with the ability and determination to overcome bad luck.\n\n ~Channing Pollock
If you have made mistakes, even serious ones, there is always another chance for you. What we call failure is not the falling down but the staying down.\n\n ~Mary Pickford
Faith is taking the first step even when you don\’t see the whole staircase.\n\n ~Martin Luther King Jr.
Enthusiasm is nothing more or less than faith in action.\n\n ~Henry Chester
I do not pray for success. I ask for faithfulness.\n\n ~Mother Teresa
You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is an ocean;if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.\n\n ~Mahatma Gandhi
It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.\n\n ~Confucius
For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.\n\n ~Ralph Waldo Emerson
We don\'t see things as they are, we see them as we are.\n\n ~Anais Nin
You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.\n\n ~Mae West
Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.\n\n ~Helen Keller
The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.\n\n ~Elizabeth Foley
A good friend is a connection to life, a tie to the past, a road to the future, the key to sanity in a totally insane world.\n\n ~Lois Wyse
The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.\n\n ~Mark Twain

There is a wonderful mythical law of nature that the three things we crave most in life -- happiness, freedom, and peace of mind -- are always attained by giving them to someone else.\n\n ~Peyton Conway March
Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.\n\n ~Mother Teresa
People often say that motivation doesn\'t last. Well, neither does bathing - that\'s why we recommend it daily.\n\n ~Zig Ziglar
Failure is not a single, cataclysmic event. You don\'t fail overnight. Instead, failure is a few errors in judgment, repeated every day.\n\n ~Jim Rohn

Keep my word positive. Words become my behaviors. Keep my behaviors positive. Behaviors become my habits. Keep my habits positive. Habits become my values. Keep my values positive. Values become my destiny.\n\n ~Mahatma Gandhi
Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.\n\n ~Albert Schweitzer
No one is in control of your happiness but you; therefore, you have the power to change anything about yourself or your life that you want to change.\n\n ~Barbara DeAngelis
Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.\n\n ~Helen Keller
Don\'t wish it were easier, wish you were better.\n\n ~Jim Rohn
The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.\n\n ~Oprah Winfrey
No matter what age you are, or what your circumstances might be, you are special, and you still have something unique to offer. Your life, because of who you are, has meaning.\n\n ~Barbara De Angelis
There are two things to aim at in life; first to get what you want, and after that to enjoy it. Only the wisest of mankind has achieved the second.\n\n ~Logan Pearsall Smith
Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.\n\n ~Mahatma Gandhi
Trust only movement. Life happens at the level of events, not of words. Trust movement.\n\n ~Alfred Adler
You have succeeded in life when all you really want is only what you really need.\n\n ~Vernon Howard
Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish.\n\n ~John Quincy Adams
Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.\n\n ~Thomas Edison
Worry never accomplishes anything. When you have a problem, it is best to concentrate on the solution to that problem, not the problem itself.\n\n ~Thomas D. Willhite
When I hear somebody sigh, "Life is hard," I am always tempted to ask, "Compared to what?"\n\n ~Sydney J. Harris
Nurture your mind with great thoughts, for you will never go any higher than you think.\n\n ~Benjamin Disraeli
Its not stress that kills us, it is our reaction to it.\n\n ~Hans Selye
The highest reward for a person\'s toil is not what they get for it, but what they become by it.\n\n ~John Ruskin
You may be deceived if you trust too much; but you will live in torment if you don\'t trust enough.\n\n ~Frank Crane
It\'s not that I\'m so smart, it\'s just that I stay with problems longer.\n\n ~Albert Einstein
No one ever won a chess game by betting on each move. Sometimes you have to move backward to get a step forward.\n\n ~Amar Gopal Bose
Men succeed when they realize that their failures are the preparation for their victories.\n\n ~Ralph Waldo Emerson

The keys to patience are acceptance and faith. Accept things as they are, and look realistically at the world around you. Have faith in yourself and in the direction you have chosen.\n\n ~Ralph Marston
Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.\n\n ~Napolean Hill
Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.\n\n ~Thomas A. Edison

All of us have bad luck and good luck. The man who persists through the bad luck - who keeps right on going - is the man who is there when the good luck comes - and is ready to receive it.\n\n ~Robert Collier
Experience is not what happens to a man, it is what a man does with what happens to him.\n\n ~Aldous Huxley
Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you\'re going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day.\n\n ~Will Durant
Destiny is not a matter of chance, it is a matter of choice; it is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved.\n\n ~William Jennings Bryan
Whatever the mind can conceive and believe, the mind can achieve.\n\n ~Napoleon Hill
All positive change in the world comes from our ideas of what we believe is possible.\n\n ~Alexandra Jamieson
Men are not disturbed by things, but the view they take of things.\n\n ~Epictetus
Be nice to people on your way up because you meet them on your way down.\n\n ~Jimmy Durante

Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited to all we now know and understand, while imagination embraces the entire world, and all there ever will be to know and understand.\n\n ~Albert Einstein
Change is not a matter of possibility, it\'s a matter of decision.\n\n ~Kevin Ngo
Life can either be accepted or changed. If it is not accepted, it must be changed. If it cannot be changed, then it must be accepted.\n\n ~Sir Winston Churchill
A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.\n\n ~Ayn Rand
You cannot expect to achieve new goals or move beyond your present circumstances unless you change.\n\n ~Les Brown
The surest way to lose sight of who you are is to constantly compare yourself to others.\n\n ~Tom Krause
Always be a first rate version of yourself, instead of a second rate version of somebody else.\n\n ~Judy Garland
You must have control of the authorship of your own destiny. The pen that writes your life story must be held in your own hand.\n\n ~Irene C. Kassorla
Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.\n\n ~Albert Einstein
Achievement seems to be connected with action. Successful men and women keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don\'t quit.\n\n ~Conrad Hilton
You don\’t get to choose how you are going to die. Or when. You can only decide how you are going to live. Now.\n\n ~Joan Baez
Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.\n\n ~Mahatma Gandhi
Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom.Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power.\n\n ~Lao-Tzu
Greatness lies not in being strong, but in the right using of strength.\n\n ~Henry Ward Beecher
It is during our failures that we discover our true desire for success.\n\n ~Kevin Ngo
